article_title: As my daughter got sicker and sicker, our quest for answers dragged on. How did we all miss the bacteria taking over her body?

images.alt: Girl in pink jumper and jeans, holding a dachshund, leafy trees behind her
images.caption: ‘It’s difficult to think of the future right now’: Milly with family dog Betty.Photograph: Ali Smith/The Guardian
Milly with parents Patrick and Lisa, sister Esme and brother Ted.Photograph: Ali Smith/The Guardian

images.alt: Writer Patrick Barkham with his wife Lisa, twin daughters Milly and Esme, and son Ted, tress behind them
images.caption: Milly with parents Patrick and Lisa, sister Esme and brother Ted.Photograph: Ali Smith/The Guardian

images.alt: Young girl standing on a rock in the Lake District, UK
images.caption: Milly in 2021, on the day in the Lake District when she probably contracted Lyme.Photograph: Patrick Barkham

images.alt: Two young girls in football kit holding trophies
images.caption: Milly in July 2021, before she fell ill, with Esme and their football trophies.Photograph: Patrick Barkham
